item.title: November Newsletter
item.description:
Pythonistas,

Our monthly meetup this month is NOT on the usual 4th Thursday which is Thanksgiving this month. Instead it will be on the 19th of the month. The December meetup will also not be on the usual date.

item.title: August Newsletter
item.description:
Pythonistas,

item.description:

item.title: January Newsletter
item.description:
Happy New Year,

Just before New Year's we crossed the 800 member milestone!

We are looking to have a cross-disciplinary (Python, R, Kline and Weka) data science workshop in late February or early March. We are actively seeking docents to help tutor and guide people interested in learning about data …
item.dc:creator: David Fischer

item.title: December Newsletter
item.description:
Hey Pythonistas,

Over the last year, you have helped San Diego Python grow from under 500 members to almost 800 members today. San Diego PyLadies has more than doubled in size to over 150 members. The meetups are better attended, and more importantly, more local developers are participating, speaking, working …

item.title: Test-Driven Django Development Workshop
item.description:
We had 40 people attend our Test-Driven Django Development workshop last weekend. Thanks to the Python Software Foundation for sponsoring this event and thanks to the Ansir Innovation Center for providing the venue! The feedback on the event was extremely positive.

In case you missed our event or if you …

item.title: October Newsletter
item.description:
San Diego Pythonistas,

We created this newsletter to inform our users about events and happenings in the local as well as larger Python community. It's also a great way to connect people looking for jobs to those with job openings.

item.dc:creator: David Fischer

item.title: Python for Data Analysis
item.description:
We had about 40 people attend our Python for data analysis workshop. Thanks to the Qualcomm open source portal team for sponsoring today's event!

Here are the presentations:

  • IPython and Numpy by Dave Cook (video)
  • Pandas by Karmel Allison (video)
  • Matplotlib by Drew Arnett (video, code)
  • Analyzing crime & census data …
item.dc:creator: David Fischer

item.title: March 2013 Meetup
item.description: Paul Collins presented on some functional programming tools in python and Trey Hunner presented on list comprehensions
item.dc:creator: Paul Collins

item.title: Analyzing Crime with Python
item.description:
Eric Busboom presented a data toolchain that could help our community analyze large public datasets with the goal of reducing the impact of crime. The meeting focused on programming tools used for analysis, the challenge of acquiring high quality data, and questions the data analysis might answer.

The San Diego …
item.dc:creator: Trey Hunner

item.title: Django Day
item.description:
We had about 30 people attend our Django Day workshop. We had both an intro track for people new to Django and an intermediate track for those who attended our previous Intro to Django workshop or have Django experience. Thanks to Cuker for sponsoring today's event!

The code and slides …
item.dc:creator: David Fischer

item.title: A Year in Review
item.description: A little over a year ago on January 12, 2012, we had the first DjangoSD meeting in months but a grand total of four people including the organizer and host attended. Since the previous organizer Ted left for silicon valley, the group had become smaller and the meetups less frequent …

item.title: San Diego Python Gear
item.description:
We have hats!

Actually we have anything you can think of with our logo on it. I had our logo embroidery digitized (whatever that means) and it can be embroidered on just about anything. Just head down to Bowlers Depot (37th and El Cajon) and mention San Diego Python. You …
